description: The name of this restaurant occupying a late-18C palazzo with attractive flooring and Murano glass chandeliers alludes to the peasant traditions that influence its cuisine (miseria) and the creative, elegant dishes served here (nobiltà). The menu features excellent home-made pastas, vegetables and meat dishes, including boned rabbit with leeks and Annurca apples and white and black truffles from the Molise in season.
